website_summaries.verdict: The Polaroid Snap Touch is a fun, affordable camera with a built-in printer, but it's slow and only offers smartphone-level image quality.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for 4 months and it has a battery problem. The battery charges to 47% and gets super hot. Contacted polaroid, and they basically said, it's not their problem.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoJournal

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother. The bad reviews are right.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it thinking that since its Polaroid those few bad reviews couldn't be that bad. They were right though. The picture quality is TERRIBLE. I compared my photos to my friend's fujifilm insta and her photos were MUCH better quality in terms of development and color saturation. For how much this costs I was very very disappointed. I'm sorry I even bothered spending this much on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this camera. We purchased two as Christmas Gifts and had to send both back due to power button failure and the screen freezing. We had to return the pink one twice. Needless to say we will look for a different camera! A good idea but the quality and durability is not there.
customer_reviews.author: D. L.

customer_reviews.title: Camera overheats and catches fire!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my 10 year old daughter for Christmas 2016 and she loved it. Conceptually, I think it is ideal for someone her age. She loves being able to take photos, edit them, add emojis, etc., and then immediately be able to print and share the photos with friends. However, yesterday she went to charge it and within 20 minutes, it started smoking and the inside was burning/melting (see attached photo). Now I'm trying to get refunded but we're so far out from the purchase date, I think I'm ineligible. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The closest thing to an instamatic you can find in ...
customer_reviews.text: The closest thing to an instamatic you can find in the digital realm. The only issue is with the method of turning it off. To turn it off, you press the flash back into the body of the camera. Mine barely catches, and not always on the first try.
customer_reviews.author: ReadToLive

customer_reviews.title: Broken 5 Months Later
customer_reviews.text: VERY disappointed with this camera. Bought this camera 5 months ago and it is now broken. Won't turn on. It was only used a handful of times and now is beyond the return date. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So excited after reading reviews.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is good for kids and I am very, very happy with purchase!! After reading many negative reviews I was disappointed thinking this camera wouldn't work or wouldn't be in like new condition as indicated. The camera came new in unopened package. After charging it it was super easy to insert the included papers/film. It takes polaroid pictures, not high quality images but that's not really the point of a polaroid. The best thing about this camera is the digital screen and the option to print or not print the pictures. I didn't want a camera that printed every time the button was clicked. (The film is not cheap.) Its really easy to use and doesn't require much input.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: However the quality of the print is really bad, not sure if my camera is defective but ...
customer_reviews.text: I give this 2 stars for the convenience of being able to take a pic and print quickly.However the quality of the print is really bad, not sure if my camera is defective but when zooming into the pic and printing the image, peoples faces become blurred and the color is really off. I’ve tried it with outside light and no zoom but the images still come out blur. Also the camera is pretty cheaply made of plastic and I had to snap on a part that was lose. For the price it costs and poor pic quality I’m returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality overall
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife in 2017 and it was trouble from the start. It first started with freezing and then continued to degrade with the power button not responding. We have used the camera intermittently since 2017 and have charged it before each use. Now it seems to not be turning on or taking a charge . I used a USB voltage and current meter to see what was going on and it proved the camera wasn't charging. After trying three cords, including a new one, I still had no luck and finally gave up. For the price of this camera I would have expected better. I will not be buying another Polaroid product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Do you like buying products that don’t work? This is perfect for you
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered 2 of these and both have not worked. From not charging or turning on, to the display screen not working, to have this happen with the same product twice in a row is pretty sad in my opinion. After the first one didn’t work right I requested a replacement and then the replacement didn’t work either. And after having bought all the accessories for it as well I can definitely say I’m disappointed with the product. Do not recommend this product seeing as how for the low price of $130 a pop, both still don’t work. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Breese

customer_reviews.title: Good choice if your like to capture the small and candid moments!
customer_reviews.text: It’s convenient if you like to capture spontaneous, candid moments! This is not a professional camera, let’s say it’s like a kind of film camera, it has just the basic buttons and although it does have a digital display, it’s not that big of a thing. At a certain moment the camera stopped working and we had to contact Polaroid customer service, but since we had bought the Square Trade device protection plan along and it was within the coverage time, our money was refunded. This is why it’s extremely important and advisable that you purchase the protection plan along when you buy an electronic device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is bad!
customer_reviews.text: The camera is great. It took me a little while to figure out how to connect it to my iphone, but I did eventually. The apps allow you to add some cool features to the pictures, which is cute. The only problem I have with the camera is that the quality of the picture is not as good as I expected for a 13 mega pixel camera, even though the video is high quality. *This is an update to my review. Unfortunately I can't send the camera back anymore, and I wish I could. The quality of the pictures is really bad.
customer_reviews.author: SagiAmazon

customer_reviews.title: First one died after 16 months, Second one arrived DOA
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera in 2017 for the holidays. We only had taken less than 30 pictures with it and had not yet even used all the paper it came with. Had an extended warranty that required I replace the item which I did in March 2019. The replacement had the same issue out of the package. The camera just stops working. When you plug the charging wire in, it just makes this fluttering noise. The device doesn't charge. I had called their "tech support" and they though perhaps someone pushed a paperclip in the microphone hole instead of the reset hole. That never happened. If you want a disappointed child, this is for you
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for fun and parties
customer_reviews.text: First, understand that this is not a professional camera, it's a point and shoot aimed at having fun and sharing pictures with friends. For that purpose, this camera is a winner. Picture quality is good. ZINK prints from the camera print quickly and look decent, especially when you consider this is just thermal paper and not instant film. Peel off the backing and your printed picture is a sticker, very cool. This camera will be very fun at family parties, my nieces and nephews will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Meece III

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!! I just got my FOURTH replacement in the mail because ALL have been defective! It was for my friend as a Birthday present and I gave it to her early so she could take it on vacation only to find out it didn’t work. I was hoping to get one that worked before she came back but #4 is yet another dud! That camera will not turn on at all. I’ve had tech support and all. I’m returning this one and not getting a replacement. I just want my money back!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Russell

customer_reviews.title: Used for a few months, sitting, now does not work at all (fully charged)
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened, I've taken a few photos, bought in 2017, picked up to take for Thanksgiving 2018 as I haven't used in several months. Charged it fully, but it won't turn on. Push the flash for it to pop up and turn on, but it does nothing. Very frustrating. Was not a cheap camera. Rated high for material, picture and print quality, because when it did work, those things were great. Even connecting to my phone was great, now nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Almost there
customer_reviews.text: I read previous reviews and was really hesitant on ordering but I was headed on vacay and wanted something fun yet practical. (1) be sure to insert an SD card, otherwise it’s a fancy toy. (2) download the update-if you don’t you get an annoy reminder when you connect to Bluetooth (3) use the companion app. Trying to figure out how to use a point a shoot was too nerve-wracking. The pictures aren’t always the best but the idea rocks!
customer_reviews.author: La Negrita

customer_reviews.title: I like the camera but BOO to Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: Boo to Amazon!! I originally gave this camera a bad review but now I believe the seller me sent a returned item. The camera died after 2 months. Polaroid honored the warranty and sent a replacement. The camera from Polaroid came in a sealed bag. The camera from Amazon did not. The screen on the replacement camera from Polaroid was far superior to the Amazon one which didn't always recognize the touch and had faded colors. The camera from Polaroid works so much better which is why I think Amazon sent me one that had been returned. Overall, I'm satisfied with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: louise m. walton

customer_reviews.title: I am very disappointed. I've had this just over a year and ...
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed. I've had this just over a year and have only used it a handful of times. As of today, it will no longer turn on. It has not been dropped or exposed to water or damaged in any way. I actually keep it in a hard box to make sure that it is kept safe. I reached out to Polaroid for information and they told me I should buy a new battery & power cord. I don't want to do that unless I'm sure that's the issue.... Feeling very frustrated.... :/
customer_reviews.author: Leyna

customer_reviews.title: It would not come on
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my Granddaughter and ruined Christmas because it would not come on. We are all educated people and tried everything to make this substandard piece of junk work. Needless to say we will be sending it back for a refund and I may suspend any future purchases from Amazon for sending stuff like this out !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought “New” but received “used and damaged”
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera “new” but when it arrived it was obviously used and did not work properly - the film door didn’t close correctly and neither did the flash bulb. I know it was used and returned at least once already because it had pictures saved on it from somebody else’s birthday party. This is unacceptable and the is no excuse for it.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera, so far printer is working great and ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera, so far printer is working great and quickly. Touch screen is great, pictures were a little smaller than i expected them to be, but that's a researching error on my part. I love the filter and options to make the photo look like the old polaroid photos. I love the option to print certain photos so you're just not wasting film, and that you can print multiple copies of the same image. The battery life is also nice. All around, if you're looking for a polaroid camera, with more options than just shoot and print, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey eliz

customer_reviews.title: dead battery after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: It was fun while it lasted, which was two months. Then I charged it one night and it wouldn't turn on the next morning. A week later it makes the noise when turned on but the screen shows nothing. Plugging it in makes it briefly say it's charging at 0% which makes me believe the battery is dead. Edit: If I let it sit a while, plugging it in begins charging and it works until the charge reaches 100%. Then it goes silent again.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Redmond

customer_reviews.title: I wanted my 6 year old to have a fun learning tool next to her teen sisters Nikon
customer_reviews.text: I guess it depends on what you are buying this camera for. Here is my side....I wanted my 6 year old to have a fun learning tool next to her teen sisters Nikon. This is very uncomplicated and my little girls has a blast with it. I chose this camera because it stores photos that can be printed elsewhere too - not just on the paper in the camera. That being said the print quality on the paper photos are nothing to write home about. they are fun, but basically poor ink jet printer photo quality. Camera is good - printer/photo print quality not super decent - but fun.
customer_reviews.author: APG

customer_reviews.title: Expensive camera for the quality and features included in this model. Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera because it’s nice and compact relative to others on the market. Both units I purchased died within the first 60 days of owning the product ($300+ In my camera graveyard). The colors are super fun, and I like that the product comes with a starter set to get up and running right away. For the money, I wish the product lasted longer. Also, Polaroid couldn’t include a bit more memory in the unit? For $179+ unit the last thing I want to do is research and buy a memory chop.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after few days
customer_reviews.text: I’m returning this product! The camera arrived and worked for a day or so and then it wouldn’t turn back on. I tried everything to make it work but it failed every try. I’m really disappointed because my sister has one and it’s awesome. I’ll be buying it from a retailer store this time. :(
customer_reviews.author: Chris Stone

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved quickly!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was disappointed when I received the wrong version of the camera with no screen at the back. I had to return that one and buy the camera all over again, fearing that it might not arrive in time. Luckily, with two day shipping, I was able to enjoy the correct camera and I love it. The photos come out better than they look on the screen and, although small, they make great souvenirs and I especially enjoy being able to add a border, decide when to print them and the fact that they are stickers.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: DIdn't turn on
customer_reviews.text: How embarrassing I purchased the camera as a gift and it did not work. I first thought maybe it needs battery so we tried charging it but the charging light wouldn't show up. no full battery (white light) nor a low battery (red light). Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sent a used one instead of New:(
customer_reviews.text: What the heck, I paid extra for the brand new package & mine came in just today definitely already used! There's little scratches on it, no protective stickers on the screen that id imagine they all come with, & a dead battery & the outside box looks all tore up. It's fine if I would have paid less for a used one, but now who knows how the battery life will be for me considering other reviews say the battery gets significantly worse just within 5-6 months of having the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked super good the first 6 months I had it but ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked super good the first 6 months I had it but now it barely turns on. It takes awhile to print and sometimes has issues printing the pictures off my phone. Also, the resolution of the pictures arent the best. lately it keeps saying that I need to shut the thing where I put the polaroid pictures but its closed so now it just won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Mello

customer_reviews.title: Terrible photo quality, dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be an upgrade from the Fujifilm instax however the photo quality is absolutely terrible no matter the camera setting. Photos are entirely blurry. Would be returning this however "terrible product" is a not a listed reason for a return according to amazon... do not waste your money. Go for the Fujifilm intax camera. Sure the photos are smaller due to the white photo border, but the photo quality is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna DeFilippis

customer_reviews.title: Was excited, but has been a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: worked for a few weeks, has been nothing but trouble since. It worked to take plenty of pictures on my trip but when we returned home and started to print out the pictures, it has died. Several times I've managed to get it to turn back on with a hard reset, but not this last time. I think the issue is that the heat it produces when printing pictures has damaged the actual device. Didn't even last the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera new and it is defective. It just would not power on and YES, i charged the camera as part of my process of elimination. I have to return it and look for another birthday present for my 12 year old daughter. This experience left a bad taste in my mouth. I am so glad I checked the camera out before giving her the gift. So SAD!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre Camacho

customer_reviews.title: I really like this camera
customer_reviews.text: I really like this camera! Sold my fugifilm instax mini 8 for it but when I saw that the film is a sticker back and not a polaroid like the install cameras I was disappointed. It will be useful for certain types of things like crafts such as scrapbooking but if you are looking for something that prints a cute polaroid with that type of look and feeling to it, i would get an install fugifilm camera! I ended up keeping this and buying another instaX camera as well!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Moe

customer_reviews.title: Fun to have at a party
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wedding reception and really liked it. My friends and family had fun using it and posing for photos that they could see withing minutes. I loved that the photos are stickers too. There is a slight learning curve when using the camera for the first time and you really need a memory card to store the photos but once you know that, its a blast to use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Haubrich

customer_reviews.title: Battery dead after 9 months, no replacement on earth
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera in Nov 2017 for a Christmas gift for our daughter. Within 9 months,it appears the battery is completely dead. It will not charge. A search online for a battery turned up nothing. We took it to a battery specialty store and they can't find one either. For the price of this camera, this is unacceptable. I left a message at the number Amazon listed for replacement parts, and if resolved I will update this. But for now...do not waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. Poor photo quality makes it useless.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. Thought my son would enjoy so got it for him for Christmas. Wanted one that would allow reprinting and would not automatically print every photo taken since film is so expensive. Photo quality is so poor that it was nearly useless. Loser Xmas gift.
customer_reviews.author: mct

customer_reviews.title: Great for photo booths!
customer_reviews.text: What an upgrade from the original Polaroid camera! I like that the pictures are saved on the camera (on the memory card you have to purchase separately) which allows you to print later on the Polaroid paper if you are trying to take multiple pictures back to back and allows you to upload to your computer. It does take 30 seconds or so to print the picture which is why having the option to print later is great!
customer_reviews.author: Bandl1216

customer_reviews.title: I'm so disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was my daughter's "big" Christmas gift. I was able to turn It on successfully maybe 3 times, and now It is completely unresponsive. I stayed up all through the night trying to troubleshoot. What a huge disappointment Christmas morning. I will hopefully update once I am able to speak with customer service on the 26th.
customer_reviews.author: VMommyL

customer_reviews.title: Product was in not even functional condition
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera to take on a fun filled vacation. Product description said "LIKE NEW". It was anything but. The front and back had several long scratches on it. The bottom had some kind of goo all over it. The flash that was supposed to pop up when pushed down didn't pop up at all. You have to pull it up and it doesn't come up easy. Looked like someone had it for years and took poor care of it. I would seriously consider looking at your products before sending it out as "like new" because now I won't be able to use the fun camera I had been planning on taking on my vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Andrew Chiholm

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun.
customer_reviews.text: This is fun to have. Prints nice pictures. It’s nice to be able to preview them before printing. I don’t take this everywhere but it’s fun to use on occasions. Everyone can grab a print of the same picture if they want. That’s a great feature not usually found on polaroids. I’m happy with my camera. Pictures are not that of a dslr but would you really expect them to be? It does print a nice picture though.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D

customer_reviews.title: $100+ is to much for the fad gadget.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter for her birthday - she seems to like it and play with it a lot but not so much anymore, the flavor it all gone like all new toys. It has a lot of different options that are cool and it's good that it doesn't just print out photos but that you can keep them on a SD card for later - that is a plus. Paid $100+ is a little too much for the gadget.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A six year old can use it, the quality is not great, it's buggy, but so far a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.text: Very buggy but we have found work arounds so far. My son loves it. A great kids camera since it is touch screen. I thought about changing it out for a pure Polaroid with better quality but then had second thoughts since this seems great for what my 6 year old uses it for. Bottom line: A six year old can use it, the quality is not great, it's buggy, but so far a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: J. Horback

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality was very frustrating
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was so excited about this, yet the quality was so poor, I had to go through 3 different returns from two different sellers before I completely gave up. None of the three that we went through lasted more than a few weeks with minimal, light use. Great concept, but simply not worth the money/headache
customer_reviews.author: Long time consumer

customer_reviews.title: Three times and OUT!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered first one. . .would not turn on. . . Amazon kindly exchanged it. . . tried again. ..same issue. . .third time not a charm. . .even called Polaroid. . .they had no idea how to get it to work. After three tries, I feel we gave it a good try. They just would not work. Would not bother to purchase, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: MrsQ

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality photos
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately had to return this item due to the low quality prints. At first the photos printed too light so I tweaked the colors and tried again but the quality was still bad. I was going to take it on vacation with me but its very low resolution (2009 quality). This would probably be a good gift for a kid. And it was also missing the magnetic lens cap so Amazon had to send me an entirely new camera, the quality on the new one was the exact same. Pretty cool concept just needs a little fixing.

customer_reviews.title: Disposable money only - doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: 3 months after purchase the battery flaked out. Won't charge and won't power etc. Tore down camera to get battery specs to replace and they don't seem to sell the battery anywhere online as they likely don't expect anyone to have to do so or have the skill to do so. I'm still searching for a battery so my daughter can use again. My advice is simply don't buy. Short lived gift and disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Don't Tread On Me

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Brought this camera for my 12-year old as a birthday gift and she loves it! It takes crisp, clear, and quality pictures
customer_reviews.author: April-Rain

customer_reviews.title: Takes terrible photos and broke
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend that no one purchases this camera. It's expensive, and it broke (like so many people's had before it). I am wondering if they sent out good ones and duped everyone that they were decent, and then switched them all with these terrible cameras that so many of us got. I certainly believe that a lawsuit could probably be made for this product. It printed about ten photos (horrible quality) and then broke never to be turned on again.
customer_reviews.author: Bari Mader

customer_reviews.title: Stop the party - I need to take a picture
customer_reviews.text: Thinking that quickly printed pictures would be a nice change from selfies, we bought this camera for fun, spontaneous photos for a party. We experimented with the Snap Touch before the party and quickly learned it wasn't up to the task. To get a good/clear photograph, your subjects have to pose very still for too long a time and even then the color is just slightly off/dull. (and forget spontaneous photos...they are nothing but a blur.) We ended up purchasing a Canon Selphy photo printer and letting everyone send their phone pics directly to the wireless printer. Bonus - full-color, full-size prints.
customer_reviews.author: Tess Griffonn

customer_reviews.title: Fun for Kids
customer_reviews.text: Gifted to 2nd grader. The fun and novelty in this in this is obviously the picture print outs. It’s fun and neat. Not meant for a smart phone or professional camera replacement. The pictures aren’t high resolution and the print outs are small.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S

customer_reviews.title: It's not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to use, but the image quality is awful. The prints come out decent, but you'll have to take care of your own lighting to get a good image quality. It's great for family outings and things of that nature, but not for professional or even semi-professional photography. To sum it up, for what you get out of it, the price should be less than $100. The thing I like best about it is the design.
customer_reviews.author: Jamal Washington

customer_reviews.title: Fine printer, crap camera
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this and play with it but it was impossible to take a clear photo. I had to take 15 photos to finally get one that wasn't blurry. I actually liked the printed picture, its a bit yellow but about as good as expected. The worst part though was the touchscreen! It was archaic. I had to clicked each button a couple of time before it registered. Returning right away. So sad :(
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Like instax camera but 100 times better
customer_reviews.text: My friends have the instax camera whichever i thought is pretty cool but i wantedan option where i can choose what photo i want to print and be able to keep the digital photos. This camera does it all. I am able to look ay photos before i print them. I can also connect it to my phone and print from my phone. It has an sd memory card slot! The photos are pretty good quality too.
customer_reviews.author: JulzS

customer_reviews.title: Made many kids happy
customer_reviews.text: Took it to Namibia where I was working in a village and children had never held a picture of themselves. it was so rewarding to see the joy on their faces when they looked at themselves in the picture. it was very easy to operate and they love seeing the picture come out.
customer_reviews.author: Helen w

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Didnt work at all Wouldn't even turn on Was a gift for my daughter for Christmas What she wanted most of all Ordered a second on and got it the 27th She waited all day with anticipation When the second one arrived we immediately plugged it in to charge Sadly it didnt work either Trying to find some sort of replacement for her Thanks Polaroid for messing up her Christmas
customer_reviews.author: E. Haley Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Good fun camera to keep photo diary.
customer_reviews.text: I am having so much fun with this camera. The card recommendation came in a bday gift planner, so I ordered. Now I use the photos in planner as a mini diary of daily events. The print quality isn't always great, comes out grainy and sometimes too dark, but I'm learning my settings on my phone thru app which help edit better.
customer_reviews.author: LokiNee

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 7 year old daughter's birthday, she absolutely loves it. It very simple to use and she had no trouble using it right out of the box, you can connect to your phone and print pictures you've taken with your phone, which works very well. We're very satisfied with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Karry

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I received this item and the battery is dead. I have tried charging it twice and no indicator to show whether the camera is charging or not. I am reaching out to Polaroid to try and troubleshoot the issue but the screen doesn't light up and no capabilities whatsoever. Intend on returning it and trying the Fuji one instead.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: There should be a recall...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camera in March to have on hand at some upcoming spring and summer events, but wasn’t able to actually charge/use it until this week. I can’t even get the thing to turn on and when you plug in the charger/USB it makes a constant rattling sound as if somethings loose/broke inside. No returns or troubleshooting help offered at this point so I’m out $150 for nothing! Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Nunley

customer_reviews.title: Won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: I opened the camera to get it set up for my granddaughter to use Christmas morning and the camera turned on one time for me to enter the date and time and wouldn't turn on again. I have requested a replacement. We shall see if the second one works. If not, I will be requesting a refund. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: A bit complicated to use
customer_reviews.text: I still haven't mastered the use of it, I've printed lots of pictures of the floor. My 94-year old mother has complained fort years that nobody gives her pictures anymore (because they're all on line), so this has made her very happy. The pictures are small, but they are "instant" so the small size is acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Don’t even bother to waste your money!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My review is really easy....I bought this camera less than a year ago and last no more than 6 months.The camera doesnt turn on and no sign of battery charging. Picture quality is beyond bad for a $150 camera. No turning on for a such new product, shows the camera was built with really cheap and bad quality materials. Reviews are very well described. Read careffully and most important STAY AWAY.....and don’t say we didn’t told you!
customer_reviews.author: Patricio

customer_reviews.title: This camera lasted only six months and is now useless.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter back in late april and after running only one pack of paper it stop working. It will not come on, Charge or anything. Very disappointing. We love Polariod at my house and use a lot of the old sx70 cameras and film. The new products are not impressive.
customer_reviews.author: wesley

customer_reviews.title: The film is easy to load and not too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Button was jammed and broken when I received the camera. The Bluetooth would not connect even after we downloaded the App. Picture quality ok. The film is easy to load and not too expensive. Interface is not intuitive. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa L

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY (WON'T TURN ON OVER TIME)
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. First order I had to return because it wouldn't turn on. Replacement one started overheating when I was charging it. I should've asked for a return again, but I decided to keep it. That was in 2017. This month, I decided to charge up the battery again, and it just wouldn't turn on anymore. Warranty has expired; Amazon won't take it back. To turn on you have to open the flash, and yes, the flash opens up, but the "on" sound doesn't come on and nothing happens anymore. Very, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: T LI

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Once the firmware update was done, the product works perfectly. There are constant updates which fixes bug issues which is definitely a +++++++
customer_reviews.author: Garvey Faucher

customer_reviews.title: Great first camera for young children
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect first camera for my elementary aged daughter. The touchscreen is easy to navigate and the photo paper is easy to reload. An added bonus is that the prints are also stickers, with an easy to peel and stick adhesive backing. While the photo quality isn’t breathtaking, it is very good for this type of camera and is definitely good enough for its intended use. I couldn’t be happier with how well it has worked and how successfully it has introduced my daughter to the fun of photography.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this Polaroid
customer_reviews.text: I love this Polaroid. I haven't used it too much but I love that you can print photos from your phone as well. I think this is a great come back for the Polaroid. It will be perfect for trips and family events. My 3 year old nephew gets a huge kick out of it also. The lens cover is magnetic which is awesome! Extremely happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pics and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and takes great pictures and prints quickly. Can also print photos from phone to camera. At times you will need to upgrade software for app which is easy. App does not allow much editing but can use any app to edit then print
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broken in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy this camera, I should read reviews before I bought it. As some people said in reviews, the camera dead in less than a year, and for my case, it broken really fast. I bought it as a gift for my wife, we used up the first pack of paper and put it away, after several months, we were plan to use it on a trip, but I found out I cannot charge the camera. I was able to return it to Amazon, but I have to pay for the restocking fee.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: High quality, it does not disappoint. Image Quality is sufficient for its purpose.
customer_reviews.text: The shipment came with all of the product I had ordered and this was not a disappointment. It is fun and my Young Teen niece loves it. The images print with decent quality, not anything exceptional but clear and sufficient for its purpose. It's not quite a Polaroid ejection of the image as one might expect from an actual Polaroid, it is actually printing so it takes a little longer for the photo to eject from the camera, but not by any obnoxious amount.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme LaFontaine

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with printer and app
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this as a fun, toy camera. However, after a few pics the printer stopped working properly (only printing a sliver of the pic) and the app wasn't allowing my phone to communicate with the printer(read the app reviews). Decided to return this and go analog with the Fuji Instax and I got the HP sprocket to print pics from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: AudraM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our Wedding!
customer_reviews.text: We used this at our wedding in lieu of a photobooth! It worked out perfect! Even when people couldn't figure out how to load the film (Due to too many cocktails) they just saved this pics and I could print it out later! It was perfect! Such a cool little camera!!
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Gifted to my daughter for 10th birthday.
customer_reviews.text: Neat little camera. Images are 1080p. Printed photos have decent clarity and color. Cost of film is reasonable. So far, it's been a well received gift by my 10 year old & she's been using it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: pvq

customer_reviews.title: Great product! if it worked longer than 30 days
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12yo & she absolutely loves it! Definite upgrade from the 80’s version. Only drawbacks are wish it weighed a little less & the app that is supposed to give you so many editing options on your phone constantly crashes.. update (4/10/2018): camera is no longer working properly, screen was stuck so I reset it now the screen won't even light up!
customer_reviews.author: Nojack

customer_reviews.title: I was super excited to get this for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to get this for Christmas. I grew up taking real Polaroid pictures. I used this camera three times and now ( 5 months later) it won't charge or turn on. I'm really disappointed in the quality of this camera.
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Kernan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't print to save its own life
customer_reviews.text: This camera is absolute junk, they tried to make a better version after the original by adding a screen and video features but the quality of video is like a Motorola RZR (if you know what that is) and I can never get the pictures to actually print. I can no longer return this product and am stuck with a bunch of Zink paper I cannot print, I wish my original never got stolen because this thing is basically a paper weight now...
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: For the price it was terrible. The pictures come out with streaks
customer_reviews.text: For the price it was terrible. The pictures come out with streaks. And i can't get it to charge so I haven't been able to get it to turn on since the battery initially died. I wish I could get my money back or a replacemt
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: I don't regret my purchase
customer_reviews.text: The actual camera function doesn't come out as well as if the photo were taken from your phone. I use mine to take daily selfies as a form of therapy; one day, I finally noticed they always came out all blotchy, which I would have thought was just the way it printed. I mostly just use the printer, TBH, so in hindsight, I should have purchased that instead of the camera. But, like I said, I don't regret buying it.
customer_reviews.author: gkangchs

customer_reviews.title: 2/10 not grunge
customer_reviews.text: does it's job as a camera but it doesn't have that ~grungy polaroid effect~ like the fujifilm polaroids. the reason i bought this one instead was i like how simple and compact it is compared to the fujifilm cameras. i'm sure it's a decent camera for fun but it's not what i was looking for at all. basically looks like you took a picture with your phone and printed it out. i'll probably sell it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a great idea, but for something that seems like it ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a great idea, but for something that seems like it should be much more high tech, it is not what I was hoping. However, it is very nice to be able to take a picture, preview it, and then decide if i want to print or retake it. And also be able to edit the picture before printing.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.text: Not good at all. It was only used twice and it stopped working. Would of liked to use it more especially since I bought a lot of picture printing paper for it. Not worth the price. I opted for this camera opposed to the fujifilm thinking it would be better considering the research I did. I guess I should of picked the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Annette

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is really bad, should have went for instax mini instead. I guess it's cool that you can take pictures from your phone and print them here, but the calibration of the printer is never right. I've tried to play with the settings and it still sucks. Will probably sell to someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Dresha

customer_reviews.title: lack of colors
customer_reviews.text: Everything is cool and all, but the picture printing and the batteries life is bad. The printer is much lack of cyan and green. So every time I printed a picture it would come out super RED. It is a miss or hut when I have to adjust the cyan and green myself.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is absolutely amazing! It takes a few seconds to print and the pictures come out with decent quality, just make sure the lighting is good when you take a picture (that was my fault though). Don't expect it to compare to a professional photography camera. The wrist strap was a bit of a hassle to get connected other than that set up was beyond simple! I already went through the ten sheets of photo paper it came with, haha. You can also use filters and various stickers from the camera itself, you can connect it to your phone through the app and send pics from it to print off as well!
customer_reviews.author: Ells Breedlove

customer_reviews.title: Snap this Polaroid up
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun camera to use when people get together. The pictures you take with the camera are a good quality but you can also print a photo from your phone. I am also using it for pictures in a journal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the Polaroid I thought
customer_reviews.text: it's decent but did have an issue on Christmas where I hit a settings and the camera just made this constant clicking sound and we could clear out of the options screen or shut the camera down. Directions are poor at best in explaining things it was quite annoying the noise - we couldn't even find the battery just to pull it out - finally had to place the camera in the car just for the silence - finally the battery wore down and everything was good. not exactly a great way to handle things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for live pictures
customer_reviews.text: Once in a while has a poor take wasting a picture or 2. Picture sizes are not large enough. Picture memory is horrible. Needs improvement for next generation especially since competing against smartphones.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: Turned on once and seemed to be working fine but then battery got hot and the screen went black! Not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Anahi Castillejos

customer_reviews.title: Battery fault
customer_reviews.text: Well if it work maybe I could use it. I have had this product a little over a year and it stopped working. Funny thing is that I had it stored away a lot of the time and maybe printed a total of 30 prints on a trip. I contacted Poloraoid and they don't even have someone that can repair it, I am not able to send it anywhere or do go anywhere. I know it's the battery, but i cannot find a replacement. It was a total waste of money. So sad!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: The product does not include what is shown in the pictures
customer_reviews.text: one of the pictures showed a 30-sheet pack, so I thought that it would come with the product. However, I realized that there are only 10 sheets that came along with the product. Please, do not put the picture of the stuff that won't be included when getting the camera. Also, I am wondering if I received a micro SD card with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Akzhol

customer_reviews.title: Unit received damaged.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. She just opened it. It seems that the power button is stuck in the down position. Flash will not stay closed. This may all be the sellers fault for selling a defective unit. The flash may or may not be working haven't gotten it to work yet. Update, I've received my replacement unit, it does not turn on and makes a loud noise when plugged into charge. Returning this unit as well.
customer_reviews.author: doyle

customer_reviews.title: Low quality camera. Pure crap
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 2 refills. Never dropped or abused. Kept in a soft case and treated with care. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera and my 5 year old loves that you ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera and my 5 year old loves that you can add borders and designs. Good quality photos. I like the Polaroid photo type photos better than these (regular glossy picture type film)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lemon?
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 1. 1st 1 was never worked right out of the box. It wasn't the battery either. 2nd 1 doesn't focus well and every picture has a blue hue no matter what we change the settings too.
customer_reviews.author: amanda butchko

customer_reviews.title: Get the app to connect the camera (print) to your phone.
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with my camera. I downloaded the app to connect the camera (Bluetooth) with my iphone and now I can even print my pics directly from my phone. Quality of pics is good. Easy to use, touchscreen is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING AFTER ONLY A MONTH
customer_reviews.text: JUST STOPPED WORKING AFTER ONLY A MONTH, I HAVE ONLY HAD IT A MONTH, WAS BEING USED AT MY DAUGHTERS SCHOOL FAIR WHERE SHE WAS DOING A PHOTO BOOTH. ALL OF SUDDEN STOPPED WORKING, IN THE MIDDLE OF THE FAIR, SHE WAS HEARTBROKEN. I AM THREE DAYS OUTSIDE MY RETURN WINDOW!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 6 month failure
customer_reviews.text: my camera wont work after had it for about 6 months used it twice and when i went to use it again it failed to turn on or charge, very disappointing after spending so much on it. and now i cant get any help because its over the return/ warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Power button failure
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this product only to find out that it wouldn't turn on. I charged it for 4 hours and it still wouldn't turn on. I am extremely dissatisfied and disappointed in this. I hope that whoever reads this rethinks their purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty Lee

product_meta.title: Zink Polaroid Snap Touch Portable Instant Print Digital Camera with LCD Touchscreen Display (Red)
product_meta.description: Capture every moment and print in an instant preserve every adventure with the Polaroid snap touch instant print digital camera. Simple one-touch operation makes it easier than ever for the whole family from kids to young adults to get in on the instant print action! Just point, shoot, and print. Then watch your memories turn into vibrant photographs that you can share. what you get polaroid snap touch instant print digital camera; Polaroid ZINK photo paper (10-pack)micro USB cable wrist strap user guide Specs & details13mp photos1080p/720P HD video built-in rechargeable lithium-ion battery built-in flash built-in selfie mirrorauto-timer6 picture modes: vibrant color, Black and white, vintage, vibrant color with Polaroid Border, black and white with Polaroid Border, and vintage with Polaroid border micro sd card slot (up to 128GB) only Polaroid products offered by authorized dealers are covered by its Manufacturer . Products from unauthorized re-sellers may be counterfeit, damaged, altered, or previously used. A list of Authorized distributors is on the manufactures website.
feature_bullets: Point, shoot, print – taking picture perfect snapshots is quick and fun. Just frame The shot using the touchscreen Display, press the shutter button to capture the image, then print The photo and watch the memories come to life.

All-in-one camera and printer – from portraits to selfies, this powerful 13MP camera with a 3. 4millimeter Lens captures every detail and prints in an instant without the need for Film and toners. It also doubles as a camcorder, so taking 1080P/720P HD video is as a simple as the Press of a button. The camera also features a microSD card slot, so you can save your pictures and print them later.

Stunningly vibrant prints – zink Zero Ink printing technology eliminates the need for ink and toners. The 2x3ʺ sticky-back paper prints are not only colorful and true to life, but are water-resistant, tear-resistant, smudge-proof, and are Dry to the touch.

Free Polaroid mobile app – take your photography to the next level by downloading the free Polaroid app, compatible with iOS and Android. No computer connections needed: simply send your photos to a smartphone via Bluetooth connectivity and unlock all the editing features Polaroid has to offer. From stickers to filters to Borders, photo editing options are easy, fun, and as endless as your creativity

Travel-ready design – The Mini, Colorful, and pocket sized design is compact, super portable and perfect for anyone who loves to travel, blog, do DIY projects, or go on adventures. An included wrist strap makes it easy to carry, Whether you’re indoors, outdoors, at a party, or on vacation.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars351 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
